V1 [url=http://truedesign.host22.com/] [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/bf3jo0.png[/img][/url] [url=http://truedesign.host22.com/] [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/15fi43a.png[/img][/url] [url=http://truedesign.host22.com/] [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/fne879.png[/img][/url] v2 [url=http://truedesign.host22.com/] [IMG]http://i667.photobucket.com/albums/vv37/krackkidsspics/sword8.png[/img] [IMG]http://i667.photobucket.com/albums/vv37/krackkidsspics/sword6.png[/img] [IMG]http://i667.photobucket.com/albums/vv37/krackkidsspics/sword5.png[/img][/url] v2.5(sorry didn't save as png) [url=http://truedesign.host22.com/] [IMG]http://i667.photobucket.com/albums/vv37/krackkidsspics/sword1-2.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i667.photobucket.com/albums/vv37/krackkidsspics/sword2-3.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i667.photobucket.com/albums/vv37/krackkidsspics/sword3-2.jpg[/img][/url]
all prims tell me what you think, about the color and over all design also I need a nameXD if you all like I will release:)

item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

mironic:

but there are un nessarsary parts on that “Example blade” for why does the “hilt” need a “Hilt”? XD the spikes at the begining is what i mean… very unnessasary in that example

very necessary if you think in combat terms. should you use that leather grip, the spikes would provide as protection should the 2 blades clash, the other blade would not contact the hand.

item.title: New Prim sword. V2.5 aded
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:35, topic:314787”]try lol… but theyd ont need to be flashy is all im saying :3… if oyu ask a craftman to make a flashy blade they wont do it… a blade needs to be like an extension of your hand… a work of art it is not its a tool… youd ont see a wrench covored in jewls or painted gold or coverd in dif colors unless that person has it for show… but theyw ill never use it becuase if they did it would ruin its value thats why the castle wars sets are for houses but u cans till were it yes… but… they are like bronze armour in def and steel in attack… so… you need more agility and str compared to flashy and nice… you wouldent want to cut someone with a blade of buity no…
becuase… of how you would swing it they would see that it is not for fighting and you will be dead they would have the sword and sell it to a rich guy that likes to hang flashy stuff on his wall… so this sword is perfect becuase as i said befor fromt he top or far away it looks roundish… but up close you;ll be dead from the illusion of it being round but your heads gone after its to late to notice

see where im getting at?[/quote]
i get what your saying, but ive been unclear of what im saying. he hasnt balanced the style and the functionability. its not like the uglier the sword the more functionable it is. this swords the perfect example. if you look at it and imagine how much a katana or a long sword weighs in your hand, then imagine a sword 50x heavier (aka this one) and thing of swinging it. itd be like swinging an 80lb metal rod around… but more sharp and brittle … a real two handed sword is more lengthy than wide. i.e. that sword is 55 inches overall. its heavy, but its not brittle or extremely thick. its functionable. the leather on the blade provides an area for grip, and to rest on your shoulder.

Read full topic

item.title: New Prim sword. V2.5 aded
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

try lol… but theyd ont need to be flashy is all im saying :3… if oyu ask a craftman to make a flashy blade they wont do it… a blade needs to be like an extension of your hand… a work of art it is not its a tool… youd ont see a wrench covored in jewls or painted gold or coverd in dif colors unless that person has it for show… but theyw ill never use it becuase if they did it would ruin its value thats why the castle wars sets are for houses but u cans till were it yes… but… they are like bronze armour in def and steel in attack… so… you need more agility and str compared to flashy and nice… you wouldent want to cut someone with a blade of buity no…
becuase… of how you would swing it they would see that it is not for fighting and you will be dead they would have the sword and sell it to a rich guy that likes to hang flashy stuff on his wall… so this sword is perfect becuase as i said befor fromt he top or far away it looks roundish… but up close you;ll be dead from the illusion of it being round but your heads gone after its to late to notice

see where im getting at?

Read full topic

item.title: New Prim sword. V2.5 aded
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

mironic:

i said sturdy stiff not pure stiff XD

none the less, the more flexible means less stress on the blade, aswell as less painful vibrations on the hand.

Read full topic

item.title: New Prim sword. V2.5 aded

item.description:
@mironic wrote:

i said sturdy stiff not pure stiff XD

Read full topic

item.title: New Prim sword. V2.5 aded
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:22, topic:314787”]loled at krackkid… its true… in battle you should not want a flashy very noticable and awosme looking blade… you want a blade thats sturdy a blade thats sharp stiff and powerfull like this one… this one has a unique round aperence from far away… but up close it is really sharp and sword like thus tricking the enemys in letting there guard down a bit…

wich this sword would be perfect for wfighting with[/quote]
No, you want an extremely flexible sword. stiff = brittle which means shattering on impact with harder objects. therefore, a ‘stiff’ blade deflected by another blade wouldresult in a fractured blade. the whole ‘smooth’ comment about letting guard down is incorrect. i personally would be just as cautious if it was a metal rod instead of a sword, where as either would kill you. this sword would in no way be perfect for fighting for. its brittle looking and heavy. all the extra weight makes it a burden to carry and swing.

Read full topic
